I'm a New Yorker I live and work in New
York
every day I ride the subway at least to
and from work often more than that I'd
like to introduce you to something that
personally drives me crazy that thing is
the emergency exit doors blaring alarm
in what feels like most of the city's
subway system these alarms go off
incessantly
although these doors are clearly labeled
emergency exit they are used nearly
every time a subway lets off a load of
passengers an average New Yorker who
rides a subway two times a day could
hear this blaring alarm four times each
day 28 times a week one thousand four
hundred and sixty times a year if each
exposure to the alarm is approximately
10 seconds that amounts to
14600 seconds a year that's four hours a
year of hearing this and yet no one
seems to question it
I would like to question it it's labeled
emergency exit really is that what it's
there for
the MTA says they were installed to
satisfy safety codes but I have never
seen it used in an emergency situation
and I've seen it used thousands of times
it seems that in its best use it's there
for people with luggage or baby
strollers who can't fit through the
turnstile but the alarms are going off
all the time and no one turns their head
I see police standing 30 feet from the
door and not turn their head why should
they it's like the boy who cried wolf
nobody paid any attention after a while
what if there were a real emergency and
I understand they've turned off some
alarms in areas that do have attendants
but what about all the others I'd like
to raise the point that if one measures
the sound the public is exposed to next
to the doors it is in fact at a level
that is probably damaging your hearing
think about all those babies who are
escorted through the emergency doors
when they're extra vulnerable to hearing
damage so the question remains is the
MTA aware that the alarms are not
serving their purpose that the doors
function mainly as service doors and
that the alarms may in fact be doing
damage to the public they serve here's
my suggestion
either stop people from using the
emergency exits and setting off the

pointless polluting damaging noise
